acknowledgments.summary: Han Leeand Matthias Kaiser from Apple Information Security reported this vulnerability to Siemens.

notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov
notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could lead to remote code execution with elevated permissions.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text:
CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov/icsSeveral recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov/icsin the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target this vulnerability.
notes.title: Exploitability

references.summary: SSA-220589: Hard Coded Default Credential Vulnerability in Teamcenter - CSAF Version
SSA-220589: Hard Coded Default Credential Vulnerability in Teamcenter - PDF Version
SSA-220589: Hard Coded Default Credential Vulnerability in Teamcenter - TXT Version

notes.text: Java EE Server Manager HTML Adaptor in Teamcenter consists of default hardcoded credentials. Access to the application allows a user to perform a series of actions that could potentially lead to remote code execution with elevated permissions. CVE-2022-31619 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.9 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details:
Harden the applicationâ€™s host to prevent local access by untrusted
personnel

Limit access to port 8082/tcp to specific IP addresses, e.g. with a
firewall

Java EE Server Manager HTML Adaptor is obsoleted. It is recommended to
use Teamcenter Management Console for Server Manager administration
Update to V12.4.0.13 or later version
Update to V13.0.0.9 or later version
Update to V13.1.0.9 or later version
Update to V13.2.0.9 or later version
Update to V13.3.0.3 or later version
Update to V14.0.0.2 or later version

As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect
network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to
operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends
to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational
guidelines for Industrial Security (Download:
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-
security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.

Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found
at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
